comment: I have computed the free free case using this framework. So this corresponds to the finite difference method with the boundary conditions correctly computed (dy/dt(0) = 0 ---> Δu = 0 around 0). My question is : where the heck has gone the 1/2 (from the trick we used to keep the matrice K symmetric)?
Every time I watch a video by Prof Strang, I think, what a great teacher. Had to say it.
38:00 "Well, you might wonder if life really is good reading the papers …" — checking the date here, looks like 2009 … so another sign Professor Strang isn't too dissociated from the real world.
